fields.description:
Based on a customer support request I believe that we should consider giving these default Crucible review permisions to the 'administrators' group in OnDemand:

* Abandon
* Close
* Delete 
* Surmise

At the very least I believe that we should give them the Surmise & Close pair. Giving them the Delete permission may be a little to heavy handed and the abandon permission might not be that useful. But I see no reason why we should not give *administrators* access to those review permissions by default.
fields.summary: User Story: As an administrator I want the permission to be able to cleanup reviews.

http://blogs.atlassian.com/2010/06/your_slas_compliancy_status_at_a_glance_in_jira/


Do you have another way to manage SLA in JIRA OnDemand?

fields.description:
We have an OnDemand instance of JIRA + Greenhopper. We have two projects, sometimes developers work across to another project. There are a few use-cases we can't achieve with JQL today.

We have upcoming major versions, say 4.8.0, where we track our sprint work. We also may do emergency maintenance releases for critical bug fixes during each sprint. Right now on our rapid board I have one swimlane for sprint work which works well as we do fixVersion in (earliestUnreleasedVersion(DSP), earliestUnreleasedVersion(JSCORE)). This requires the ordering of the version to be very specific in the Manage Versions page.

But if we have a short term maintenance release, say 4.7.3, there is no easy way to display this in a swimlane. I'm forced to use fixVersion = "4.7.3" and each time we release, I have to go in and edit each filter to increment the version number.

It would great if we could somehow categorize versions, or be able to search against the fixVersion field using contains (~) operator so we could have some extra metadata in each version name like "4.7.3 (staging)".
fields.summary: Need more options for searching against fixVersion in JQL

This issue can be alleviated by using [Bitkinex|http://www.bitkinex.com/]; however, this would be a temporary workaround as new users would be attempting to mount the WebDav directory as a network drive as documented here: [Accessing your WebDAV directory in Windows Vista - Uploading Data via WebDav|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Uploading+Data+via+WebDAV#UploadingDataviaWebDAV-AccessingyourWebDAVdirectoryinWindowsVista].
fields.summary: Webdav Directory Could Not Be Mapped as a Network Drive in Windows

fields.description:
Just like Zendesk, it would be nice to have JIRA integration with Pivotal: https://www.pivotaltracker.com/help/integrations?version=v3#jira

At the moment, we understand that JIRA OnDemand does not have any method to make outbound HTTP requests, as this integration heavily depends on this:
bq. You may need to open up your firewall to allow incoming requests from Tracker integrations (for example, if you have an internal JIRA instance). If this is needed, ask your network administrator to allow the IP addresses of "api.pivotaltracker.com" and "api2.pivotaltracker.com". However, please note that the IPs assigned to these addresses may change without notice. You can use the commands host api.pivotaltracker.com and host api2.pivotaltracker.com to confirm the current IP addresses.
fields.summary: Support Pivotal Integration

fields.description:
Hey guys,

A customer reported this behavior when trying to remove a resolution from his OnDemand instance that seems to be a bug. Here's what I did in order to reproduce it:

I've created a resolution in my own OnDemand instance and resolved an issue with it. Then I tried to remove that resolution. Before deleting it, I was warned that there was one issue resolved that needed to be changed. I changed to "Fixed". After pressing "Delete" I got the stack trace pasted below.

I went back and re-opened the issue that contained that resolution and resolved it with a different one. Then I tried to remove the resolution that now had 0 issues and it was successful.

So basically something fails when it needs to bulk change issues, but it works when there is no issue with that resolution.

Best regards,

fields.description: We would like the ability to modify the columns that display for subtasks within the parent issue view. This is possible with standalone JIRA, but does not seem to be possible with OnDemand. We would like to be able to select from both standard fields and custom fields. We would like to be able to also control the position of each column in the subtask view. Finally, if more columns are chosen than will fit, we would like a horizontal scroll bar to automatically appear, so that we can quickly scroll to the right-most columns.
fields.summary: Modifying subtask columns showing in parent issue view

fields.description:
When you go to source in a project, there to the trunk tab and subsequently to reports you will see a graph of lines of codes in this trunk.
While this is good to see trends an additional feature is to see the sum of all the lines, maybe at the end of the graph, or while hovering over it at any spot on the graph.
fields.summary: SVN - show sum of Lines of Code for whole trunk

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Request for JIRA Commit Acceptance Plugin to be considered as bundled plugin for JIRA OnDemand:

https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.ext.commitacceptance
fields.summary: Plugin request for JIRA Commit Acceptance Plugin

fields.description:
Please add JIRA project import as one of the restricted functions in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Restricted+Functions+in+Atlassian+OnDemand, until [AOD-2658] is fixed.

Potential workaround would be:

* Support provides whole JIRA backup to restore locally, customers perform project import by themselves, then import back to OnDemand
* Use remote APIs
fields.summary: Add JIRA project import to restricted functions list

fields.description:
In http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Importing+Data, it is stated that:

bq. You can import issue data into JIRA OnDemand from other issue trackers such as JIRA, JIRA Hosted or third-party issue trackers (e.g. Bugzilla).

Truth is, you can only use the JIRA importer to import from a JIRA site backup. Other issue trackers like Bugzilla cannot be imported using this importer; they need to be imported to a local JIRA at the first place.

Also, in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Importing+Issues, it is stated that:

bq. With the JIRA Import Wizard, you can import issues into JIRA OnDemand from JIRA instances, JIRA Hosted instances or third-party issue trackers such as Bugzilla.

Again, the wizard does not take care of other issue trackers directly.

I understand that we do not intend to provide such misleading information, as this is stated in "Step 1. Get the data", "step 1", which clearly tells how to import from other issue trackers.

bq. Third-party issue trackers only: Import data from your existing third-party issue trackers to a local JIRA instance. Find the instructions on the Migrating from Other Issue Trackers page.

It would be great if this messaging can happen (early) at both locations I mentioned above.
fields.summary: Potential misleading information in "Importing Data" doc

fields.description: So that customers don't lose work, or aren't surprised by outages, it would be nice if we could set up a warning message for 10 minutes before the maintenance to let users know that their Atlassian OnDemand instance is about to go down and they should save any work immediately.
fields.summary: Set up a warning message for maintenance to let customer's know their instance is going down

fields.description:
In OnDemand JIRA 5 the keyboard shortcuts are available for dropdown links beneath the tabs, like Dashboard/Issues/Agile. However, the Project tab dropdown doesn't have shortcut although JIRA 5 standalone does.

Make the (Modified + p) shortcut available for Project dropdown in order to switch projects with keyboard.

Relates issue: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-34045
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts for Project dropdown

fields.description:
Hi, we would like to test the CustomWare JIRA SalesForce Connector, I have generated a trial licence and would now like the plugin installed. Here is the response I have received from JIRA Studio Support -

Abdoulaye Kindy Diallo Atlassian added a comment - 22/Feb/12 2:51 AM

Hi Mark,

Thanks for contacting us.

I am sorry to inform you that, based on JIRA Studio Plugin Policy: "JIRA Studio comes with a set of pre-defined plugins. Customers cannot install new plugins or remove existing plugins. Here is the link for further details: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/JIRA+Studio+Plugin+Policy"

Requests for additional plugins (or upgrade) should be created as a feature request at https://studio.atlassian.com under the JIRA Studio project.

In light of the above I am afraid it is not possible to install this plugin. I am sorry about any inconvenience.

Finally, I would suggest to try and submit a feature request.

Should you have any other concern, you are more than welcome.

Cheers,
Diallo,
fields.summary: CustomWare JIRA SalesForce Connector Plugin v5.0.2

fields.description:

fields.description: Previously the "Header Text Colour" in the look and feel options would change the Projects drop down as well as the "Issues", "Wiki", "Source", "Reviews" and "Builds" tab. Now (as of JIRA 5 release), it only changes the tabs, and not the project drop down, as a result if your header background colour is white then you won't be able to see the Projects drop down.

e.g. if ABC-123 is moved to BCD-234, users can't search for ABC-123 in quick search.
fields.summary: Quick search to cater for old issue keys

fields.description:
Some users have a workflow where they may have commits to a repository that affect multiple projects. The commit and smart commit features in OnDemand should support allowing a single commit to update and attach to multiple project issues at once.

Repo key: ABC
Project Keys: ABC, DEF

In a way that you could cross-commit comments such as:

From the ABC repository:
"DEF-22 Fixing the bug foo reported on DEF project to the ABC software"
OR
"ABC-12 DEF-22 #resolve #comment Finally fixing that old bug affecting both our projects"
fields.summary: Allow Commit and Smart Commits Across Projects
